New Records: Kusal Mendis' 77-ball 122-run knock is the fastest hundred by a Sri Lankan in World Cup history
Sadeera Samarawickrama picked up his maiden ODI ton with a 89-ball 108
Key Match Events: Mendis batted with absolute authority, clobbering six maximums and 14 fours
Samarawickrama cracked 11 boundaries and two sixes in his 89-ball knock
Hasan Ali claimed four wickets for 71
Haris Rauf took two wickets for 64
Shaheen Afridi struggled with his line and length, conceding 66 runs in 9 overs
Sri Lanka crossed the 200-mark in the 28th over
Mendis hit four boundaries off Hasan Ali in one over
Hasan Ali removed Kusal Perera early in the innings
Nissanka and Mendis joined hands for a 102-run partnership
Mendis reached three figures with a flick over deep mid-wicket for a six off Hasan Ali
Pakistan conceded just 18 runs between 30 to 35 overs
Mohammad Nawaz removed Dhananjaya de Silva
Afridi got rid of Dasun Shanaka
Samarawickrama held the innings together to keep Sri Lanka on track for a 350-plus total
Miscellaneous Highlights: Sri Lanka posted their highest World Cup total against a Full Member
The pitch slowed down towards the end of the innings
